intro: Argylia bustillosii, commonly known as the Mexican bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it produces small, showy blooms during the summer months. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, although it is not widely distributed outside its native range.
